# fault(_:)

**Instance Method**

Writes a message to the log about a bug that occurs when your app executes.

## Declaration

```swift
func fault(_ message: OSLogMessage)
```

## Parameters

- **message**: The interpolated string that the logger writes to the log. Each of the message’s interpolations can specify individual formatting and privacy options. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/message-argument-formatters].

## Discussion



Use this method to write messages with the [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSLogType/fault] log level to both the in-memory and on-disk log stores.

## Logging a Scoped Message

- **notice(_:)**: Writes a message to the log using the default log type.
- **debug(_:)**: Writes a debug message to the log.
- **trace(_:)**: Writes a trace message to the log.
- **info(_:)**: Writes an informative message to the log.
- **error(_:)**: Writes information about an error to the log.
- **warning(_:)**: Writes information about a warning to the log.
- **critical(_:)**: Writes a message to the log about a critical event in your app’s execution.
